qas.question: what was the name of the first long term settler?
what year did the first permanent settler arrive?
what did one of the settlers rename the islands?
From where was the last permanent settler to the islands?
Who was the last permanent settler to the islands?
In which month of 1810 did the last permanent settler arrive to the islands?
In which year did the last permanent settler arrive at the islands?
Where did the only survivor, Thomas Currie, remain a dead man?

context: The first permanent settler was <a0_0><b4_0>Jonathan Lambert<b4_0/><a0_0/>, from <b3_0>Salem, Massachusetts, United States<b3_0/>, who arrived at the islands in <a1_0><b5_0>December<b5_0/> <b6_0>1810<b6_0/><a1_0/> with two other men. Lambert publicly declared the islands his property and named them the <a2_0>Islands of Refreshment<a2_0/>. After being joined by an Andrew Millet, three of the four men died in 1812; however, the survivor among the original three permanent settlers, Thomas Currie (or Tommaso Corri) remained as a farmer on <b7_0>the island<b7_0/>.
